description: Perona's personal quarters within Thriller Bark's mansion, decorated with an elaborate gothic-lolita aesthetic featuring numerous cute stuffed animals, pink and black color schemes, and gothic furnishings. The room serves as her command center where she can deploy her Negative Hollows.
significance: This is where Usopp discovers his immunity to Perona's powers and volunteers to fight her alone, marking a major character moment for him.
geographicalFeatures: Filled with stuffed animals and cute decorations
Gothic-lolita aesthetic with pink and black color scheme
Part of Thriller Bark's massive mansion structure

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Arrive at Perona's Quarters
keyEvents.description: Zoro, Usopp, Sanji, and Franky reach Perona's elaborately decorated room where they encounter the Ghost Princess.

keyEvents.title: Perona's Negative Hollows Overwhelm Three Straw Hats
keyEvents.description: Perona uses her Negative Hollows to incapacitate Zoro, Sanji, and Franky with crushing depression.

keyEvents.title: Usopp's Immunity Revealed
keyEvents.description: Usopp discovers he is completely immune to Perona's Negative Hollows in this room.

keyEvents.title: Salt Star Technique Debut
keyEvents.description: Usopp debuts his Salt Star technique against Perona's zombie servants in her room.

keyEvents.title: Usopp Volunteers to Fight Alone
keyEvents.description: Usopp tells his crewmates to go ahead while he stays to fight Perona in her room.

statusHistory.description: Perona's personal quarters in Thriller Bark mansion

description: The massive Gothic mansion that serves as the central structure of Thriller Bark, Gecko Moria's floating island ship. The mansion contains multiple floors, a freezer where Oars was kept, various rooms including Perona's quarters, and serves as the main base of operations for the Thriller Bark Pirates.
significance: The primary battleground for the Thriller Bark arc where the Straw Hats fight Moria's commanders and zombie forces.
geographicalFeatures: Central tower/mast of Thriller Bark ship
Various themed rooms for different commanders
climate: Indoor, various climate-controlled zones including freezer

keyEvents.title: Pursuit Through the Corridors
keyEvents.description: Luffy's group chases Gecko Moria through the mansion corridors toward the freezer.

keyEvents.title: Oars Destroys Parts of the Mansion
keyEvents.description: Oars creates a pirate hat from debris he tore from the mansion structure.

keyEvents.title: Franky Creates Bridge
keyEvents.description: Franky constructs a corduroy bridge to cross broken stairs destroyed by Oars.

name.japanese: スリラーバークの冷凍庫

description: A massive freezer chamber within Thriller Bark's mansion where Gecko Moria kept the ancient giant Oars' body frozen for centuries before reanimating it with Luffy's shadow. The freezer is large enough to contain a being of Oars' enormous size.
significance: The location where Oars was stored and the destination Luffy pursues Moria toward in this episode.
geographicalFeatures: Large enough to contain a giant of Oars' size

keyEvents.title: Luffy Reaches the Freezer
keyEvents.description: Luffy finally arrives at the freezer and spots Gecko Moria resting inside.

statusHistory.description: Storage location for Oars' frozen body, later used by Moria

name.japanese: スリラーバークの礼拝堂

description: A Gothic chapel within Thriller Bark where Absalom attempts to forcibly marry the unconscious and drugged Nami. The chapel is filled with zombie generals serving as wedding guests.
significance: The location of Absalom's attempted forced marriage to Nami, one of the arc's major conflicts.

keyEvents.title: Absalom's Wedding Ceremony Continues
keyEvents.description: While the Straw Hats battle throughout the mansion, Absalom's forced wedding to Nami proceeds with zombie generals cheering.
